sentences: Laurie Anders (January 16, 1922 â€“ October 5, 1992) was an American actress and singer, best known for her work with television personality Ken Murray.
Anders was born and grew up on a ranch in Casper, Wyoming.
Still in Wyoming, she joined a country band as a singer.
She relocated to California in the 1940s, eventually finding her way to Ciro's nightclub in Los Angeles as a cigarette girl.
Laurie Anders was a regular on the variety program The Ken Murray Show for its full run, from January 1950 until June 1953.
Previously unknown, she was given a solo number in the production number "Oh, Susanna".
Previously television shows had been unwilling to air a song unknown to audiences, in fear of audience displacement.
Together with Arthur Godfrey, Anders had a top-20 hit with the song I Like the Wide Open Spaces, partially composed by Ken Murray which was released by Columbia Records in 1951.
In the mid 1950s, she toured as a featured performer in WLW's "Midwestern Hayride."
By the late 1950s, Anders had ceased working as an actress.
In 1974 she married Leslie Raddatz, a publicist, and became known by the name LoRaye Raddatz.
She died of cancer on October 5, 1992 at age 70, at her home in the Tarzana, Los Angeles neighborhood.
